summary.para: Note The IFilterMapper interface is deprecated. Use instead.
Provides an enumerator that enumerates registered filters that meet specified requirements.

param.name: ppEnum
param.para: Address of a pointer to the enumerator returned.

param.name: dwMerit
param.para: Minimum merit value of filters to enumerate.

param.name: bInputNeeded
param.para: Value indicating whether there must be at least one input pin; TRUE indicates at least one input pin is required.

param.name: clsInMaj
param.para: Input major type required. Set to GUID_NULL if you do not care.

param.name: clsInSub
param.para: Input subtype required. Set to GUID_NULL if you do not care.

param.name: bRender
param.para: Flag that specifies whether the filter must render the input; TRUE means that it must.

param.name: bOututNeeded
param.para: Value indicating whether there must be at least one output pin; TRUE indicates at least one output pin is required.

param.name: clsOutMaj
param.para: Output major type required. Set to GUID_NULL if you do not care.

param.name: clsOutSub
param.para: Output subtype required. Set to GUID_NULL if you do not care.

remarks.para: Set the ppEnum parameter to be an enumerator for filters matching the requirements. For a description of merit values for the dwMerit parameter, see the method.

summary.para: Note The IFilterMapper interface is deprecated. Use instead.
Adds a filter to the registry; the filter can then be enumerated.

param.name: clsid
param.para: Globally unique identifier (GUID) of the filter.

param.name: Name
param.para: Descriptive name for the filter.

param.name: dwMerit
param.para: Position in the order of enumeration. Filters with higher merit are enumerated first.

remarks.para: The merit (as defined by the dwMerit parameter) controls the order in which the filter graph manager tries filters when performing an operation as a result of a call to , , or . The filter graph manager finds all filters registered with the correct media type and then tries the one with the highest merit, using other criteria in the registration to choose between filters with equal merit.

summary.para: Note The IFilterMapper interface is deprecated. Use instead.
Registers an identifiable instance of a filter.

param.name: clsid
param.para: GUID of the filter.

param.name: Name
param.para: Descriptive name of the instance.

param.name: MRId
param.para: Pointer to the returned media resource ID. This parameter is a locally unique identifier for this instance of this filter.

remarks.para: This method handles cases such as when two similar sound cards that are driven by the same driver are available, and it is necessary to choose which card will emit the sound. This is not needed if there is only one instance of the filter (such as when there is only one sound card in the computer), or if all instances of the filter are equivalent.
The filter itself must have already been registered.

summary.para: Note The IFilterMapper interface is deprecated. Use instead.
Records the details of the pin in the registry.

param.name: Filter
param.para: GUID of the filter.

param.name: Name
param.para: Name of the pin. This should be unique within the filter. It has no significance other than to indicate type information. You should not use pin names longer than 99 characters, because this causes filter enumeration problems.

param.name: bRendered
param.para: Value specifying whether the filter renders this input. Set to TRUE if it does; otherwise, set to FALSE.

param.name: bOutput
param.para: Value specifying whether this is an output pin. Set to TRUE if it is; otherwise, set to FALSE.

param.name: bZero
param.para: Value specifying whether the filter can have zero instances of this pin. If it can, set to TRUE; otherwise, set to FALSE. For example, a decompression filter doesn't need to create a sound output pin for a movie without a sound track.

param.name: bMany
param.para: Value specifying whether the filter can have many instances of this pin. If it can, set to TRUE; otherwise, set to FALSE. For example, a mixer might have multiple instances of its input pin.

param.name: ConnectsToFilter
param.para: Reserved. Must be NULL. (This is intended for filters such as system-wide mixers that have connections outside the filter graph. It is not yet implemented.)

param.name: ConnectsToPin
param.para: Reserved. Must be NULL.

summary.para: Note The IFilterMapper interface is deprecated. Use instead.

param.name: clsFilter
param.para: Class identifier (CLSID) of the filter to which the pin belongs.

param.name: strName
param.para: Name by which it is known.

param.name: clsMajorType
param.para: Major type of the media sample supported by this pin class.

param.name: clsSubType
param.para: Subtype of the media sample supported by this pin class.

remarks.para: The clsMajorType and clsSubType parameters specify the media type of the pin and correspond to the structure's majortype and subtype members, respectively.

summary.para: Note The IFilterMapper interface is deprecated. Use instead.
Removes the registration of this filter from the registry.

param.name: Filter
param.para: GUID of the filter.

summary.para: Note The IFilterMapper interface is deprecated. Use instead.
Removes the registration of this filter instance from the registry.

param.name: MRId
param.para: Media resource identifier of this instance.

summary.para: Note The IFilterMapper interface is deprecated. Use instead.
Removes the registration of this pin from the registry.

param.name: Filter
param.para: GUID of the filter that this pin is part of.

param.name: Name
param.para: Name of the pin.

summary.para: Note This interface has been deprecated. It will continue to be supported for backward compatibility with existing applications, but new applications should use the interface.
This interface provides methods for registering and unregistering filters, and for looking up filters based on their characteristics.
